revised_title: Wave Propagation and Shock Formation in Elastoplastic Media
tldr: This article investigates the propagation of plane irrotational waves through elastoplastic media, focusing on interactions between elastic and plastic waves and the formation and propagation of shock waves. The author derives a stress-strain relation and analyzes the breakdown of a smooth plastic compression wave into a shock wave, showing that the heat dissipated is proportional to the cube of the strain jump. The article also presents a solution for the elastic unloading of a plastic compression front during shock formation and provides a numerical illustration for a particular pulse in aluminum.
